item.text:
**Selecting diverse indie and genre horror figures**

I'm compiling a focused list of 8–10 notable indie/genre horror creators drawing from beyond Wikipedia, prioritizing reputable sources like Bloody Disgusting, Dread Central, and festival coverage to mix emerging and recognized talent for a well-rounded profile.

**Preparing cited indie horror filmmaker list**

I'm organizing a vetted list of 10 indie and genre horror filmmakers with specific citations for each, using credible sources like Bloody Disgusting, Dread Central, Entertainment Weekly, and festival mentions, and planning a concise commentary inviting preference on US vs. international focus.

Love this prompt — indie horror is such a fertile, surprising corner of filmmaking, and I’m happy to help you build a solid follow list.

Here’s a curated starter set of indie/genre filmmakers to follow, with a quick “why” for each:

- **Laura Moss** — Director of the indie body-horror *Birth/Rebirth*, a distinctive, character-driven take on Frankenstein. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birth/Rebirth?utm_source=openai))  
- **David Charbonier & Justin Powell** — A duo behind *The Boy Behind the Door* and *The Djinn*, two lean, high-tension indie horror features. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Boy_Behind_the_Door?utm_source=openai))  
- **Nicolas Pesce** — Director of *The Eyes of My Mother*, a striking black-and-white indie horror feature. ([bloody-disgusting.com](https://bloody-disgusting.com/indie/3414901/interview-eyes-mother-director-nicolas-pesce/?utm_source=openai))  
- **Danny Philippou & Michael Philippou** — The RackaRacka twins who broke out with *Talk to Me*; great to follow if you like bold, modern horror sensibilities. ([abc.net.au](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-07-25/talk-to-me-directors-rackaracka-a24-horror-film/102632948?utm_source=openai))  
- **Monica Moore-Suriyage** — Horror shorts, festival presence, and work highlighted by Dread Central; a strong emerging voice. ([dreadcentral.com](https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/532148/meet-panelists-for-best-genre-film-festivals-sidebars-2025-2026/?utm_source=openai))  
- **Gigi Saul Guerrero** — One of the directors featured in the indie horror anthology *Satanic Hispanics*; great if you want more Latino horror perspectives. ([ew.com](https://ew.com/movies/satanic-hispanics-trailer/?utm_source=openai))  
- **Eduardo Sánchez** — Also part of *Satanic Hispanics*; a key indie horror filmmaker to keep tabs on. ([ew.com](https://ew.com/movies/satanic-hispanics-trailer/?utm_source=openai))  
- **Demián Rugna** — Another *Satanic Hispanics* contributor; strong genre credentials and indie roots. ([ew.com](https://ew.com/movies/satanic-hispanics-trailer/?utm_source=openai))  
- **Alejandro Brugués** — Yet another of the anthology’s directors; a useful name for Latin American indie horror. ([ew.com](https://ew.com/movies/satanic-hispanics-trailer/?utm_source=openai))  
- **Mike Mendez** — Horror mainstay and *Satanic Hispanics* director; prolific and very indie-friendly. ([ew.com](https://ew.com/movies/satanic-hispanics-trailer/?utm_source=openai))  

If you want, I can narrow this to a specific lane, like micro-budget U.S. filmmakers, international festival darlings, or short-film specialists.
